content:
Diagnosis:	Fibrolamellar hepatocellular carcinoma

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Right hepatectomy

Histology:	pT3N0M0 fibrolamellar variant HCC, CK7 and CK19 positive, R0 resection

Current Situation:	Post-operative surveillance

I reviewed [redacted name] in clinic today following his recent CT scan. He has made an excellent recovery from his right hepatectomy performed in January. His wound has healed well and he reports good energy levels, having now returned to work part-time. His appetite is normal and weight is stable at 72kg. Liver function tests remain within normal range with ALT 32 and bilirubin 12.

The surveillance CT performed last week shows expected post-surgical changes in the right liver with no evidence of recurrent disease. The remaining left lobe shows normal enhancement patterns with no new lesions identified.

We have discussed the surveillance plan, and I will arrange to see him again in 3 months with repeat imaging and blood tests including AFP. He understands to contact us sooner if he develops any new symptoms of concern.
